channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Instagram might soon let you remove yourself from someone’s Close Friends list
item.description: Since the feature's launch in 2018, users haven't been able to remove themselves from someone else's Close Friends list.

item.title: Blue Origin pauses space tourism flights to focus on the moon
item.description: The company is trying to take advantage of President Donald Trump's desire to return astronauts to the lunar surface by the end of his term.

item.title: George R.R. Martin Almost Planned a Very Different Kind of Targaryen Power for ‘Game of Thrones’
item.description: There have been some hints of it in 'House of the Dragon' and 'A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms.'

item.title: This AI-related lawsuit could be just the beginning of many
item.description: Two workers are suing an AI hiring platform, alleging the technology violates consumer protections. What many applicants may not realize is that, nowadays, the first hurdle in applying for a job is dealing with AI. Candidates now often must clear an artificial intelligence system that screens their résumés that quietly determines who advances, and whose application is filed away in a drawer or spam folder, never to see the light of day. ...

item.title: You might qualify for this Kaiser settlement without ever filing a complaint
item.description: Customers who received multiple marketing texts after unsubscribing may qualify for compensation. If you’ve received any text messages from California-based healthcare giant Kaiser Permanente, you could be eligible for cash under the terms of a new settlement.

item.title: What to know about Trump’s Fed chair nominee Kevin Warsh
item.description: At 35, Warsh became the youngest governor on the Fed’s seven member board, serving in that post from 2006 to 2011. President Donald Trump says he’ll tap former Federal Reserve governor Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair to replace Jerome Powell in May — with Trump believing that he can finally get the booming economy that he promised to voters.

item.title: Sonos’ Super Bowl sale knocks hundreds off its audio gear
item.description: Sonos isn’t exactly synonymous with the Super Bowl, although the brand discounts its gear every year around this time like clockwork. It’s knocking 20 percent off many of its marquee products, including soundbars and standalone speakers — all of which can be paired together to improve sound quality and to put audio in more places […]

item.title: I Let Google's ‘Auto Browse’ AI Agent Take Over Chrome. It Didn't Quite Click
item.description: Auto Browse can shop for clothes, plan a trip, and buy tickets for you. Or at least, that's the idea.

item.title: Elon Musk Emailed With Jeffrey Epstein to Plan Island Visits in 2012 and 2014
item.description: Epstein wrote an email to Musk in 2013 discussing a visit with four "assistants," newly released DOJ documents show.

item.title: Nvidia's next-gen full Earth-2 digital twin AI models will predict and forecast the next big storm faster and more accurately
item.description: Nvidia Earth-2 AI models integrate high-resolution data and open source tools to deliver faster, more accurate global and local weather forecasts.

item.title: The Farmers’ Almanac isn’t dead. It’s getting a digital reboot under a new owner
item.description: The almanac will keep operating despite announcing in November that its 208-year run was coming to an end. The Farmers’ Almanac isn’t going out of business after all, but it is leaving Maine for the bright lights of New York City and a new owner.

item.title: NASA used Claude to plot a route for its Perseverance rover on Mars
item.description: Since 2021, NASA's Perseverance rover has achieved a number of historic milestones, including sending back the first audio recordings from Mars. Now, nearly five years after landing on the Red Planet, it just achieved another feat. This past December, Perseverance successfully completed a route through a section of the Jezero crater plotted by Anthropic's Claude chatbot, marking the first time NASA has used a large language model to pilot the car-sized robot. Between December 8 and 10, Perseverance drove approximately 400 meters (about 437 yards) through a field of rocks on the Martian sur...

item.title: Fitbit users now have until May to migrate to a Google account
item.description: Fitbit users who are holding out on moving their data over to a Google account now have until May 19th, 2026 to make the switch. The previous deadline was just days away on February 2nd, but that date has been updated on Google's help page for Fitbit account migration. The post also now specifies that, […]

item.title: Could Poop Pills Be a Secret Weapon Against Cancer?
item.description: Two new studies highlight the potential of fecal microbiota transplantation as a boon to cancer immunotherapy.

item.title: Stocks slide and gold fever fades as investors weigh Trump’s Fed pick
item.description: The price of gold has suddenly run out of momentum following a tremendous rally where it roughly doubled over 12 months. Financial markets are churning on Friday as investors try to figure out what President Donald Trump’s new nominee to lead the Federal Reserve will mean for interest rates. The initial reactions were uneasy because of the uncertainty....

item.title: Seeing Is Believing at Your Own Peril in ‘After God’
item.description: Sumi Eno's dystopian fantasy manga is a criminally underrated hidden gem that's writing circles around its contemporaries.

item.title: Wave bland wall spaces goodbye: I tested two of my fave digital photo frames head-to-head, and this option is perfect for giving gloomy winter rooms a glow-up
item.description: I pit my two fave digital photo frames against each other – while both are absolutely gorgeous, this is the one that will light up your living room the most.

item.title: How a unique ‘chatbot’ is helping a small Chilean community push back on AI
item.description: Ask ‘Quili.AI’ anything, and residents of Quilicura will answer your queries themselves—no data centers needed. If you enter a query into Quili.AI on January 31, your question won’t be answered by a large language model, but instead by residents from the Chilean community of Quilicura.

item.title: Google’s Project Genie Is Not for You
item.description: Google tries the Yann LeCun approach.

item.title: Luigi Mangione won’t face the death penalty for UnitedHealth CEO’s killing, judge rules
item.description: Judge Margaret Garnett dismissed a federal murder charge that had enabled prosecutors to seek capital punishment, finding it technically flawed. Federal prosecutors can’t seek the death penalty against Luigi Mangione in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, a federal judge ruled Friday, foiling the Trump administration’s bid to see him executed for what it called a “premeditated, cold-blooded assassination that shocked America.”...

item.title: Rivian made an electric ambulance for Grey's Anatomy
item.description: America’s once-promising EV transition may have taken a U-turn, but at least some in Hollywood are trying to do their part. Rivian partnered with Grey’s Anatomy to make a custom electric ambulance for the long-running series.The ambulance is a modified version of Rivian’s Commercial Van. The custom “vanbulance” serves a dual purpose: preventing on-set exhaust fumes (which could harm the cast and crew) and integrating a green storyline. “As an added benefit, the elimination of engine noise brought a welcome quiet while cameras were rolling,” Rivan wrote in a blog post.Among other modifications,...

item.title: 3 Great Heated Blanket Deals on My Favorite Affordable Models
item.description: Some of our favorite heated blankets are on sale (and might even arrive in time for you to use this weekend).

item.title: SpaceX’s IPO could open the floodgates — and secondaries are booming in the meantime
item.description: To unpack what SpaceX’s IPO chatter means, how private liquidity works before a debut, and what investors are looking for in today’s pre-IPO giants, we spoke with Greg Martin, managing director at Rainmaker Securities, a broker-dealer specializing in secondary share transactions for late-stage private companies.

item.title: This startup, backed by Bill Gates, is looking to transform computing as we know it - optical transistors could upend Moore's Law and allow more powerful GPUs
item.description: Neurophos develops optical GPU Tulkas T100, achieving 470 petaFLOPS, high RAM, and SSD integration, aiming to advance AI computation.
